result.execSummary:
The defendant Kris Coleman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges under Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply. Credit for 4 days.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all costs and surcharges by 11-07-2016 or if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kris Coleman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kris Coleman in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 60 days in the House of Correction with credit for 4 days time served.  Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 9 months.
Conditions:
*  Perform 20 hours of community service;
*  Pay all costs and surcharges by 11-07-2016 or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment;
*  Submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Kris Coleman in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Ian Franklin Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for sentencing. Defense counsel requests more time. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 21. All parties are advised effective August 1, 2016 this case will be assigned to the Honorable Michael Hanrahan, Branch 4 in Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kris Coleman in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for sentencing. On motion of Defendant, Court ordered case adjourned in branch 21.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kris Coleman in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 21.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kris Coleman in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Motion for severance filed by State.  Defense no objection.  Court grants State's motion for severance. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court vacates jury trial date of 3-07-2016 and converts it to a plea and sentencing date.  All parties are advised effective February 1, 2016 this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 04, Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
State's Motion for Severance, received and filed.

Defendant Kris Coleman in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Alex Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial.  Court advises parties that any documents must be filed by final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 37.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Kris Coleman in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. For reasons stated on the record, the Court granted the defense request for a status conference case. Case adjourned to Branch 23. All parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45, in Room 515 of the Courthouse due to the rotation of Judge Grady in Branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kris Coleman in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for adjourned status conference. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kris Coleman in court.  Student Intern Morgan Wilz under the supervision of  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant requests additional time to obtain private counsel.  Court grants request and orders case adjourned for status of counsel.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.
  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kris Coleman in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Defendant Kris Coleman in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
